well, i'm not gdb expert, but my libgdk-x11-2.0.so.0.400.10 is stripped. Hm. Come to think of it, how would the func be found by the linker then?
Well, that's not a problem.
The debugger nows the name of the functions, but not its parametrization.
Have in mind that the names need to be known to do the linkage stuff.
To ilustrate it, just try an objdump -T <some_stripped_so_lib>
You should see the symbol names.
ah-ha.
What you don't have is another debug info.
Like the function parameters, source code link,...
cool, thanks. I've used nm to track down link errors in the past, but objdump looks more useful
or at least, differently useful ;)
objdump has a lot of other options. You can disassemble, for example.
